column4: Hello, I just had a ton of disk space disappear on me. My drive is now 95% full. What happened? Ubuntu 9.04
Um, could you dump the output of "df -h" in a pastebin?
Again, of you dump the output of df -h, we might be able to troubleshoot this issue better.
It would appear that you have used up 96 gigs of space on the drive... Did you install anything, uh, major in the past few weeks?
No, I didn't
That just outputed a gigantic list
if you install pastebinit, then run du -hsx /* | pastebinit, that should automatically pastebin that list so eli_ can have a look at it.
Did you, by chance, create a Machine in VirtualBox?
No
Are you positive?
Because that can take up a *lot* of space.
I am positive
I haven't even opened Virtual Box yet, since installing
Having worked in tech support, I feel the urge to ask you to open virtualbox and check, just incase. Sorry if that sounds a bit patronising; it's not meant to. :)
I work in tech support as well
It appears VirtualBox has disapeared.
Actually, anything clasified as "System Tools" gets lost after a while...
I noticed that TrueCrypt keeps disapearing after instalation.
Oh, I know
I'm pretty sure there's nothing personal in there..
I'll delete it afterwards to get rid of my email address.
If not, it won't show in about 10 minutes. ;)
Please don't play with the bot.
